metadata.title: CVE-2020-5255 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: In Symfony before versions 4.4.7 and 5.0.7, when a `Response` does not contain a `Content-Type` header, affected versions of Symfony can fallback to the format defined in the `Accept` header of the request, leading to a possible mismatch between the response's content and `Content-Type` header. When the response is cached, this can prevent the use of the website by other users. This has been patched in versions 4.4.7 and 5.0.7.

criterions.comment: symfony package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.8-1').
